article: Jerry is a popular manager of a restaurant. It was his attitude  _  made the waiters follow him. He was a natural motivator . If a(n)  _  was having a bad day, Jerry was always there, telling him/her how to look on the  _  side of the situation. This attitude really made me  _  , so one day I asked him, "I don't get it! No one can be a positive person  all the time  . How can you manage it?" "Every time something bad happens, I can choose to  learn from  it. Every time someone comes to me complaining, I can choose to accept their complaining and I can  point out  the positive side of life. Why don't we just do that later?" Jerry said. Jerry told me an unusual story out of his experience. One day he left the back door of his restaurant  _  and was robbed by three men. While trying to open the safe, his hand, shaking from  _  , slipped off the combination . The robbers got angry and  _  him.  _  , Jerry was found quickly and taken to the hospital. After 18 hours of surgery and weeks of care, Jerry  _  with fragments of the bullets still in his body. I saw Jerry about six months after the  _  . I did ask him what had gone through his mind as the accident took place. "Did you lose consciousness? Weren't you  _  ?" I asked. "No," Jerry said, "  _  when I saw the expressions on the faces of the doctors and nurses, I got really scared." "A nurse asked if I was allergic to anything. 'Yes' I replied. The doctors and nurses stopped  working  as they waited for my reply. I took a deep breath and yelled, '  _  !'" "Over the laughter, I told them, 'Please  _  on me as if I am alive, not dead.'" Jerry survived  thanks to  the skill of his doctors, but also because of his amazing attitude. Attitude, after all, is  _  .
